Posts.Content: SO Scared!  There is a great new book that I think you would find helpful. It is uplifting and empowering.  Check it out on the web:  www.alumpintheroad.com I am now 1 and 1/2 years out, you can do this!
Posts.Title: SO Scared!

Posts.Content: There is a new book out for young breast cancer survivors and  their families.  It is called JUST A LUMP IN THE ROAD...Reflections of young breast cancer survivors written by Debbie Leifert.  It is positive and empowering.  It talks about dealing with hair loss and so many issues that YOUNG women have. There is also a website for the book: www.alumpintheroad.com.  Check it out! I thought it was very helpful.
Posts.Title: New Book for Young Breast Cancer Survivors

Posts.Content: I am not sure where you live, but click on the following link to maybe find an anastasia location near you.  There was a counter at my local mall.  http://www.anastasia.net/  The beauticians will shape your brow now, and then you can buy a kit with stencils.  They teach you everything you need to know to have great looking eyebrows.  I suggest you do it before they fall out.  I still use it today after my eyebrow have come back.  Even during chemo, I got great compliments on my eyebrows!!!!!  Check it out.  Another thing that helped me was a book called JUST A LUMP IN THE ROAD... By Debbie Leifert.  Hope this helps!
Posts.Title: Eyebrow "replacement"?

Posts.Content: Definately seek out a Lymphadema Specialist.  Ask at your local hospital for a name.  Most hospitals are staffed with them.  From watching a friend go through this, it is not something to take lightly.  There is also a good book we read, during our treatment called:  JUST A LUMP IN THE ROAD... by Debbie Leifert.  It has a whole section written by a Lymphadema specialist, with signs, symptoms and exercises.  It is very easy reading, like a guide.  Keep smiling...
Posts.Title: lymphedema
